Check out the JUnit FAQ.

If you want to test the exception handling code, =
then the general approach is this:

1. Simulate throwing the SQLException s=
o that the exception handler is forced to catch it.
2. Verify that the exce=
ption handler catches it and handles it as expected.

You need to force an =
object to throw the particular SQLException you want to throw into the obje=
ct that is supposed to handle it. Without knowing what those objects are, I=
 can't write a better description of the solution.

Good luck.

So said  Tu=
ngWaiYip <tungwaiyip@...>  on  3/3/2003 --------------------

>
>

>thos=
e code get poor coverage. Some are added defensively and is only 
>invoked =
in rare siutation. Is there any good way to exercise them?
